comment: Great spice , potpourri and oak smell. Complex flavor and spicy. Smooth spicy finish. Excellent

My first thought was that it was a little smoother and sweeter than I normally go for, however as I sipped it I found myself finding new flavors and depth. It became a surprisingly enjoyable and delicate experience that I would have again!
Incredibly smooth with a great range of subtle and not so subtle notes.
Absolutely amazing! One of the best in the world.
Delicious and smooth, with subtle hints of vanilla and spices.
Shoots straight, but long and sweet.
84? 84? In what world is this an 84? I was expecting a 95 and would have expected anything above a 92. There is maybe 3 better Irish whiskeys in the world.
The fact that this is only rated an 84 is a travesty. Hands down one of the best Irish whiskeys available.
Maybe the reviewer got a bad year? This is hands down the best whiskey I have Haas, though my bottle is a 2011...
One of the best blends I have had. This was a great gift from my brother in law for my wedding.
Not sure how this app rates at an 82. One o the finest whiskers you can imbibe. It I. Hard to say but it both seems both very complex yet extremely simple.
I love this whiskey.  Best I've had to date.  Much better than current rating on this app.
Favorite irish whiskey- Smooth, good flavor- not too light or heavy
Midleton.  Very subtle caramel scent and flavor.  Very easy to drink and smooth, but I'd like more flavor
Won a personal taste test of 7 Irish Whiskys I tasted at the Whisky Attic in Las Vegas. Smooth, crisp and light with green apples and some tangy goodness. It's a sleeper in terms of its low rating.

Tried this sat at an Irish bar one night, not thinking that I liked Irish whisky. How wrong I was. Stunning. Beautiful, full flavour, with absolutely no burn whatsoever. If it wasn't £8 a nip, I think I'd have happily sat there all night and drained this 2013 release.
    It's important I own / drink a bottle of my own. Top shelf material !
  
  *I now own a bottle of the 2015 release. Happy days ! ☺

Just perfect. This is just liquid gold. Really prominent vanilla, very little burn when enjoyed with a tiny splash of water and just so smooth. Its a shame it's so expensive and a huge shame it has such a low rating. This is now my favorite whiskey. I really want to try the new batch finished in virgin Irish oak casks, hopefully it will be as good.
I just found the 2008 bottle. Haven't opened it yet.
One of the best whiskeys I've ever tasted , super smooth, tons of flavors, sweet vanilla light caramel , worth the price
Very good and interesting Irish, smooth as silk. Good example of style but I like a little more brashness in my whiskey.
Rare expensive. Dry. But Very Smooth.
wonderfully balanced.  smooth.  nothing out of place
Smooth, full. Brown sugar. Some spice, similar to a rye.
One of my favorites for sipping.

This is a real treat. Lots of stone fruit, dangerously drinkable.  Not a long finish, but very very good. Definitely best Irish I have had. This whisky is in my top 10 for sure. An 84 rating is embarrassing.  They ranked jack Daniels #7 higher....
Very smooth, sweet, lingers on the tongue
Sweet and spicy. Lovely balance. Vanilla. Absolutely Delish! A keeper for special occasions.
Incredibly smooth. Some people say it is not that complex and that is pretty accurate. It is the best whiskey I have ever drank.
Amazingly smooth, perfect balance. Only better Irish whiskey is the Barry Crockett Legacy
rotbraune Farbe, aber schwach im Geruch. zuerst fruchtig dann holzig, aber enttäuschend wenig intensiv. flacht schnell ab. seinen Preis nicht wert
SPWAS St Pats Day - BD brought as gift to club. Good but not terribly complex.
Very good, sweet but not fruity or briny

My definitive opinion is in the name itself: a very rare occasion it will be before I choose to drink this whiskey again.  It already takes guts to release something WITHOUT AGE STATEMENT and sell it for $300 CAD, but then to be this disappointing... The nose is initially pleasant with notes of apples, but that quickly changes as an off-putting odour becomes prominent - imagine aged and slightly rotted wood. The palate has a nice touch of vanilla and caramel, with a finish that's extremely smooth though short, but by then the damage has irreparably been done.
The Berger boys drink. No bite, smooth, vanilla notes, soft burn as it goes down.
Kind of light and delicate with complexity buried deep.

Nose: marmalade, toasted oats. Plenty of jam notes at front, so I may disagree w reviewer to some extent about fruit being subtle. Still, not surprisingly, Moreno is on target about the value. Even if I concede that this is a touch better than Green Spot or Redbreast, the price comparison gives strong edge to those two offerings. Finish is long, sweet, and pleasant... mostly vanilla.

It’s a pleasant enough whisky with the classic Irish character of light vanilla and coconut. The body is medium to light and my main issue with this - is that it doesn’t deliver for the money. I would expect and like some complexity of flavors for a price of 150 bucks
Really good. Smooth with vanilla and caramel notes. Sometimes star ratings from reviews are more accurate than "expert" ratings.
We had the 2015 when we were in Ireland. Sara and I enjoyed it very much
One of my all time favorites. Smooth and balanced

This is just a great Irish whisky. It has a nose of vanilla and clove. 

On the tongue, the spices become present without punching you in the face. The finish is extremely smooth and pleasant. 

I wish this didn’t have a $150 a bottle price tag. It would make a wonderful everyday drinker.

Tasted: 2016 ( a double - $50 gift card) and 2017 (Bottle x 2). Why rated so low? Is it the exquisite smoothness of these blends? Or maybe the absence of burn? As if that is needed to enjoy any whisky, especially one of this character. I know it took me a while to fathom the smooth complexity of this whisky. Something tells me it is the exclusivity and price for same which is responsible, as many today have become ultimate bargain seekers and will not settle for less. Well let them pass it over. There will simply be more for those of us who love it.
            
            $219.99 USD in PA
One of my favorites. Smooth.........Lots of flavor without the burn. The rating is surprisingly low. I assume the hefty price tag may be partly to blame.
Spicy notes but smooth without burns.
Smooth as hell. Woody on the back. Not much at the front actually. Almost too flat.
Oak and vanilla nose. Slight spice on the tongue. Almost a bit a tart but not off-putting. Decent blend overall.
Quite complex, vanilla with spice and lots of barrel favour. Big and powerful stuff. Honey aftertaste’s.
Incredibly smooth and delightful. Nose has a very light sweet shortbread smell. The taste is perfectly balanced. This whisky is what all other Irish Whiskys aspire to be.

Burunda:
Armut, kirmizi elma, kuru meyve reyonu, keciboynuzu

Damakta:
Armut, bal, kayisi, mango
Tremendous magnificent whiskey.  Bananas, vanilla, sweet and spice.  Typical Irish whiskey notes.  The finish is full, flavorful and more sweetness.  This is a premium dram, very enjoyable.
Excellent Spicey caramel. Easy to drink. Worth the price? Not sure. But excellent
